    Eases between two quaternions by a step.
    static Quaternion Quaternion.conj​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
    Returns the conjugate of the quaternion, where the imaginary component is negated.

    a* = { areal, -aimag }

    Creates a quaternion from three axes - either separate vectors or the columns of a matrix.

    Creates a quaternion from the axes of a matrix, which is assumed to represent a rotation only (i.e., does not include translation or scale).

    static Quaternion Quaternion.identity​(Quaternion target)
    Sets the target to the identity quaternion, ( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ).
    static Quaternion Quaternion.inverse​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
    Finds the inverse, or reciprocal, of a quaternion, which is the conjugate divided by the magnitude squared.

    a-1 := a* / |a|2

    If a quaternion is of unit length, its inverse is equal to its conjugate.
    static Quaternion Quaternion.inverse​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target, Quaternion conjugate)
    Finds the inverse, or reciprocal, of a quaternion, which is the its conjugate divided by its magnitude squared.

    a-1 := a* / |a|2

    If a quaternion is of unit length, its inverse is equal to its conjugate.
    static Quaternion Quaternion.mix​(Quaternion origin, Quaternion dest, float step, Quaternion target)
    Mixes two vectors together by a step in [0.0, 1.0].
    static Quaternion Quaternion.mul​(float a, Quaternion b, Quaternion target)
    Multiplies a scalar and quaternion.

    Multiplies a quaternion and scalar.
    static Quaternion Quaternion.mul​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b, Quaternion target)
    Multiplies two quaternions.
    static Quaternion Quaternion.normalize​(Quaternion q, Quaternion target)
    Divides a quaternion by its magnitude, such that its new magnitude is one and it lies on a 4D hyper-sphere.
    static Quaternion Face3.orientation​(Face3 face, Handedness handedness, Quaternion target)
    Returns the orientation of the vertex as a quaternion based on the face's normal.
    static Quaternion Vert3.orientation​(Vert3 vert, Handedness handedness, Quaternion target)
    Returns the orientation of the vertex as a quaternion based on the vertex's normal.

    Creates a random unit quaternion.
    Quaternion Quaternion.reset()
    Resets this quaternion to an initial state, ( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ) .

    static float Quaternion.dot​(Quaternion a, Quaternion b)
    Finds the dot product of two quaternions by summing the products of their corresponding components.

    a b := areal breal + aimag bimag

    The dot product of a quaternion with itself is equal to its magnitude squared.

    Finds the length, or magnitude, of a quaternion.

    |a| := a a

    |a| := a a*

  • Uses of Quaternion in camzup.kotlin

    Subclasses of Quaternion in camzup.kotlin 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  KtQuat
    Provides Kotlin operator overloading support for quaternions.
    Methods in camzup.kotlin with parameters of type Quaternion 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    KtQuat KtQuat.minus​(Quaternion b)
    Returns a new quaternion with the subtraction of the right operand from the instance.
    void KtQuat.minusAssign​(Quaternion b)
    Subtracts the right operand from the instance (mutates the quaternion in place).
    KtQuat KtQuat.plus​(Quaternion b)
    Returns a new quaternion with the addition of the right operand to the instance.
    void KtQuat.plusAssign​(Quaternion b)
    Adds the right operand to the instance (mutates the quaternion in place).
    KtQuat KtQuat.times​(Quaternion b)
    Returns a new quaternion with the product of the instance and the right operand.
    KtQuat KtVec3.times​(Quaternion b)
    Returns a quaternion the product of the instance promoted to a quaternion and another quaternion.
    void KtQuat.timesAssign​(Quaternion b)
    Multiplies the right operand with the instance (mutates the quaternion in place).
    Constructors in camzup.kotlin with parameters of type Quaternion 
    Constructor Description
    KtQuat​(Quaternion source)
    A copy constructor.
